question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, unambiguous, and made publicly by Biden or his campaign, leaving no possibility of him accepting the nomination for the 2024 election.

Given this, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model be greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM? Resolves YES if it is >46.6% at that time, and NO otherwise.

This analysis considers the impact of Biden's decision on Harris's perceived chances in the model, as tracked on Nate Silver's platform.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? (b) Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(b) Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is removed or blocked from a primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will he be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024. This removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports, and is not reversed by that date.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution is based on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of the eventual outcome of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (2) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. Note that the question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Asa Hutchinson must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, which is impossible if Donald Trump Jr. is the nominee. Therefore, if Donald Trump Jr. is the nominee, this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: If Joe Biden dies before Saturday, will he remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden dies before Saturday, with an official announcement of his death made before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (b) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET).

Resolves NO if either Joe Biden does not die before the specified time or he does not remain President through the specified time. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect the resolution regarding his presidency.

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Given the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals, will they top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. Then, will the USA be the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves positively if the USA is the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. Resolves negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. The ranking is determined by the number of Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals in that order.

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals and also top the Olympic Medal Table at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (b) The United States Olympic Team is the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The ranking is determined by the number of Gold medals, followed by Silver, and then Bronze medals. The question resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It resolves negatively if either condition (a) or (b) is not met.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(b) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024 (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators must work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of unnamed democrats will not satisfy this criterion unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. If these criteria are not met, this condition resolves NO.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign must make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made prior to the deadline, this condition resolves NO.

This combined question resolves YES if both (a) and (b) occur as described above.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Will Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?
question.body:

question.title: Conditional on Taylor Swift's cameo, will Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Taylor Swift appears in the movie 'Deadpool and Wolverine' in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. This will still be considered true even if she is not credited on IMDB, as long as it is confirmed by independent sources.

Then, will 'Deadpool & Wolverine' have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie? Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie. The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

The record for the biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M globally ($152.2M domestic). This market will resolve YES if 'Deadpool x Wolverine' grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release.

In summary, if Taylor Swift cameos in the movie, will it break the record for the biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Taylor Swift will cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine, and (b) Deadpool & Wolverine will have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
Resolves YES if both of the following happen:

(a) Taylor Swift appears in the "Deadpool x Wolverine" movie in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. This will resolve YES even if she is not credited on IMDB, as long as her appearance is confirmed by independent sources.

(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" movie grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend according to reports, and the Hollywood Reporter (or an equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release.

question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite credible media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. 

For condition (1), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For condition (2), the question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this condition will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: If Biden remains President through July 2024, will Trump be removed from any state ballot under 14th Amendment Section 3?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden remains the President of the United States through the end of July 2024. This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not affect this status.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? This resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The resolution is "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question strictly pertains to the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not consider legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after this date. If Trump is removed or blocked and then reinstated such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024, and will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

Both conditions must be met for this question to resolve as "Yes".

(b) Anthropic publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Given the EU announces new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024, will at least 5 Dem House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the potential link between two political events. Suppose the following is true: Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles. Given this scenario, is it true that a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators will work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For the outcome to resolve as YES:
- The EU must announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024.
- At least five named Democratic House Members or Senators must collectively pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, through a group action, such as signing a letter or a collective in-person request.

If either of these conditions is not met, the question resolves NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (2) at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(1) The first condition will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(2) The second condition will resolve as **Yes** if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter, as reported, or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Given 538 projects Biden as the favorite on Friday, will Kamala Harris’ VP pick be Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected by FiveThirtyEight to have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump, as indicated by the blue trend line on the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast. This is based on the data available for July 19, with the resolution occurring as soon as July 20 data is available, or by July 22 if July 19 data is missing.

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris will announce her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, 2024? This resolves YES if Kamala Harris confirms either Kelly or Shapiro as her VP pick, and NO if she confirms anyone else.

The resolution criterion for the condition is based on FiveThirtyEight's data, while the outcome is based on Kamala Harris' announcement.

question.title: Will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, and will Kamala Harris choose Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her VP pick?
question.body: This question resolves to 'Yes' if both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024, as per the blue and red trend lines on https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/; and (b) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7, 2024, confirmed by Kamala herself. The resolution of FiveThirtyEight's forecast will wait for the July 20 datapoints to become available, and if unavailable by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19. The VP pick resolves when confirmed by Kamala Harris.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

Then, is it true that a member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024? This resolves **Yes** if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee:

 - Barron Trump

(2) One of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump. If both conditions are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average. This is measured as a positive value between 2 and 3, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Resolution criteria for this condition: This is based on the national polling average reported by 538 for July 15, 2024, as accessed on July 17, 2024.

Then, is the following true? Will Joe Biden or his campaign make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President for another term in the 2024 cycle?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no possibility for Biden accepting the nomination. If no such announcement is made by the specified time, the outcome resolves as No.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle.

If both conditions are satisfied, the question resolves as **Yes**. If either condition is not satisfied, the question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

question.title: Conditional on Kamala Harris becoming President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This determination will be based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

Then, is the following true? Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves YES if he remains President, and NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting; and (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET), without resigning, dying, or otherwise ceasing to be President before then. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not affect the resolution of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: If Joe Biden does not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP nominee?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. This statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Given this situation, will Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate? The resolution is YES if Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, the resolution is NO. Changes to the VP after the initial nomination do not affect the resolution.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and will Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic VP?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. (2) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

If either of these conditions is not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Given Nvidia's market cap is larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, will at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, the market capitalization of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Then, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

Resolution criteria for this outcome: 
- This resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).
- This could be by signing a letter, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.
- All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.
- Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO.
- If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's, and will at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if both of the following occur: (1) On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). (2) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: Given Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP nominee, will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. Then, will Larry Elder be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria:
- For Kamala Harris: Resolves YES if she is nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected, resolves NO. Changes after the initial nomination do not affect the resolution.
- For Larry Elder: Resolves YES if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates resolve as NO. The resolution is based solely on the selection by the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP nominee and (2) Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) Kamala Harris: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this condition is met. If someone else is selected as VP, it is not met. The VP nomination is determined at the time of the initial nomination and is not affected by any changes thereafter.

(2) Larry Elder: This condition is met if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the nomination on the day of the election; it is determined by the selection at the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Given Czechia qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Georgia also qualify?

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

question.title: If a swimmer wins the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport?
question.body:
The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

This question about women's team sports resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

Suppose the following is true: A swimmer wins the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals and (b) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport?
question.body:
(a) The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

(b) This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

question.title: Conditional on Sha'Carri Richardson winning a gold medal, will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: Suppose Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games, which resolves YES if she wins gold in any event from August 1 to August 11, 2024. Given this, will France place in the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves YES if France ranks in the top 5 by total medals, considering gold, silver, and bronze counts, with ties resolving positively. If the Olympics do not take place in 2024, the question resolves ambiguously.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games: (a) Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal and (b) France places in the Top 5?
question.body:
This question resolves positively if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal in any event during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. Track and field events will start on Thursday, Aug. 1, and conclude on Sunday, Aug. 11. Sha'Carri Richardson is scheduled to compete on the following days:
- Women's 100m: Friday, Aug. 2, to Saturday, Aug. 3
- Women's 4x100m Relay (lineups not yet announced): Thursday, Aug. 8, to Friday, Aug. 9

(b) France places in the top 5 in the medal table at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Given that GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Greens–EFA also hold the most seats?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This question resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group also holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, meaning both groups are tied for the most seats. It resolves as **No** if Greens–EFA does not hold the most seats. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will both GUE/NGL and Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both the GUE/NGL and the Greens–EFA political groups hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This can occur if both groups are tied for the most seats. The question will resolve as **No** if neither or only one of the groups holds the most seats.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Given Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will USD be worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents. This will be determined by comparing two Manifold polls that close on July 6. One poll includes Joe Biden on the hypothetical ballot, and the other includes a generic Democrat. The condition is met if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more, calculated using the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).

Then, is it true that the USD will be worth >= 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024? This will be resolved according to the USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents? (b) Will USD be worth >= 145 JPY (yen) at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) Market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance. Will USD be worth >= 145 JPY (yen) at close on August 9th, 2024?

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

question.title: Conditional on Biden dropping out before July 20, will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Kamala Harris announce her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. Resolves NO if Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate. The pick must be confirmed by Kamala Harris herself.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20 and (b) Kamala Harris picks either Kelly or Shapiro as VP before August 7?
question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. (b) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, confirmed by Kamala herself. The market resolves YES if both (a) and (b) occur as described. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Glenn Youngkin is the Republican nominee, will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, is it true that Chris Christie is also selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria: 
- Glenn Youngkin is the nominee if he is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
- Chris Christie is the nominee if he is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Note: Only one individual can be the nominee. If Glenn Youngkin is the nominee, Chris Christie cannot also be the nominee, and vice versa.

question.title: Will both Glenn Youngkin and Chris Christie be the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Glenn Youngkin and Chris Christie are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question considers the condition where Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, as reported by 538 and accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. 

Given this condition, the question then asks whether Vivek Ramaswamy will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution is based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the election day itself.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Portugal qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Poland also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Poland qualify for the Grand Final?

Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will both Portugal and Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Portugal or Poland does not qualify, or if neither qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Conditional on there being another Democratic party presidential debate, if Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Given this, if President Joe Biden drops out, will a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is a debate as described. Resolves NO otherwise.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the media coverage condition is met. Resolves NO if Biden drops out but the condition is not met. Resolves N/A if Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Another Democratic party presidential debate takes place (b) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given the Republicans Party of France forms an alliance with the National Rally, will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election. This means that before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. If no such agreement is announced, this condition is not met.

Then, is it true that the Prime Minister of France will belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024? This resolves as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following are true: (a) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. If no such agreement is announced, this component resolves as **No**. (b) On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together, according to credible sources. If the Prime Minister's party is New Popular Front or Together, this component resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Ted Cruz being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This resolves as Yes if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as No.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If no such statement is made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.
